result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler J Wilson-Isaacson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex with Child Age 16 or Older, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.09.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on Wednesday, February 17, 2016.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must have no contact with K.R.H. - DOB: 6/29/1998.
Must have no unsupervised contact with any juvenile females except his daughter, A.A.I.

Must complete a sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended therapy or counseling.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Court holds issue of sex offender registry open pending sex offender evaluation.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyler J Wilson-Isaacson in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Count 2 is Dismissed and Read In.  State relates.  Attorney Hinde relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 1 year Probation - Must report to Probation by 3:00 PM on Wednesday
Must complete a sex offender evaluation and comply with any recommended therapy or counseling
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must have no contact with K.R.H. - DOB: 6/29/1998
Must have no unsupervised contact with any juvenile females except his daughter, A.A.I.
Court holds issue of sex offender registry open pending sex offender evaluation
Must submit DNA sample and pay surcharge
Court costs

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court - Must report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday, February 16, 2016 between 1:00 - 5:00 PM.
Defendant was fingerprinted today.

Prior: 2086 Polo Garden Drive Apt 201, Wellington, FL 33414 United States

Court indicates defendant was to be fingerprinted today.  Court orders defendant to be fingerprinted by 2/15/16.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
to Appear signed by Defendant for Public Defender's Office

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

Must have no contact with K.R.H. - dob: June 29, 1998.
Must have no unsupervised contact with any juvenile females.
Must report to Barron County Jail on January 4, 2016 to be fingerprinted.

Attorney John Gerard Hinde in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Authorization to appear filed. Defendant stands mute and court enters not guilty plea. State advises bond has not been set - Attorney Hinde relates - Court relates. Defendant Tyler J Wilson-Isaacson appears by phone.  Court relates.  Bond to be faxed to Court in West Palm Beach County, Florida to be signed and faxed back.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney John Gerard Hinde in court.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State requests body only warrant - statewide execution. 
Attorney Hinde requests opportunity to produce authorization to appear.
Reset.
  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.
